reviews.text: If you prefer chain hotels, this one isn't for you. If you like incredible mountain views, a warm rustic feel and being surrounded by like-minded people, this IS for you! An added bonus is an on-site dining facility with breathtaking mountain views and too- notch service.
reviews.title: Perfect Setting for Outdoor Enthusiasts
The view
reviews.text: Stayed there middle of September in room 133. The service was great,food was good, and lots of beer and wine. The room was clean, rustic, and of course the view. The guest shop had a fleece sweatshirt at a good price that came in handy for the dip in the temperature. The Inn was very handy for our day trips on our motorcycles around the parkway.

We stopped in off the Blue ridge impromptu hoping to stay a couple nights. They only had vacancy for the one night but the front staff was as accommodating as could be. We stayed in room 132, which was in the last building called "Tree Top". The view was probably one of the less desirable but still couldn't be beat by any other accommodations in the area! After our one night stay, we were very disappointed not to be staying a second. My husband mentioned how friendly the maintenance man which helped him jump our truck the morning of departure. He couldn't believe how helpful he was & then refused to take a cash offering for all his efforts. We will be back!
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are old but well kept and clean. All have private balconies or porches. The guests above us arrived very late so we heard them coming in. But the beautiful views make up for any inconvenience. The staff was very friendly and provided some item we forgot. Would certainly go again.
reviews.title: Beautiful views, clean room
Take my breath away!
reviews.text: This simple yet lovely inn with rocking chairs on every balcony with views that are soooo beautiful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I live in Asheville and always wanted to stay the night at Pisgah Inn. Well finally got to do it and I am so pleased we did. I am also ashamed I had not tried sooner. It is less than an hour from home but feels like a million miles away. The view is completely uninterrupted from the rooms - and it looks like it has for millions of years - you do not see any developments or cars - just pure mountains. We stayed in the Treetops building which has been refurbished and updated. Comfortable beds and very clean. The wooden rockers on the balcony were brand new and clean. Only thing I saw in the other rooms that I wish our room had was a small table and chairs inside so you could sit and watch the view. I think the older rooms have that so it is a trade off. The room included a hardy breakfast in the dining room that is cooked to order with homemade biscuits.
reviews.title: I loved my stay at this Inn
I love this place.
reviews.text: I live in Asheville and go up to the Pisgah Inn all the time and love dining in the restaurant and staying in the Inn sometimes just to get away and get that mountain feeling. I felt I had to qualify the review that is from the people who reviewed today, October 4 who hated the place and felt they were treated rudely. Please cut the owners, management and staff a little slack. They were ordered by the government to close down due to the "shut down" and they had just a few days to get everyone out and cancel all reservations at what it usually a peak time of year when these private mom and pop places in the mountains make all there money for the year. Go easy. People are out of work and places are facing losing their businesses. And while the Inn is practically like camping out there is a great charm to staying here. I love this place.

Very simple but just what we wanted as a base point for our hiking each day. Very convenient to many trails, clean, great restaurant and super friendly staff!! We would definitely consider staying at the Pisgah Inn again in the future.
reviews.title: Spectacular views

reviews.text: Pisgah Inn is a simple yet clean motel with a great view. You can't beat the view along with the free hot breakfast. It was a great deal. If you want to get away in the mts away from everything yet have access to a great restaurant, come here.
reviews.title: Pisgah Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't need to say much about the great views, you can read that from the other reviews. In the space of two hours we saw a very dark gray overcast, sprinkling rain, clouds even darker gray, a drop in temperature, then very dense fog, then clearing in time for a beautiful sunset. You can't get that in very many places with a view like that. The owner of the property served our coffee the next morning in the restaurant. The restaurant deserves our heartfelt praise. They could get by with third rate food and high prices, but the food is excellent and the prices very reasonable. You can order top line entrees for $ 30.00 or so, but they also have meat loaf and chicken pot pie for much less. Wine is expensive, but you can drink ice tea. The room we stayed in was splendid, but had a connecting door to the room next door. Even with the door closed and locked, we could hear every word of our neighbors' conversation, and they were not speaking loudly. You need to hope that you don't have a dog next door.
reviews.title: Good value with great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the fourth time my wife and I stayed at The Pisgah Inn and we were pleasantly surprised. The last time was a couple years ago and the place was getting worn out and was not even that clean. It has been totally renovated since then and is greatly improved. They kept the same sort of semi-rustic mountain cottage style, and repainted everything, brought in new furniture, new bathroom fixtures, new curtains, and even completely new windows. The view from the restaurant has always been and still is unbeatable. The food is better now but still reasonable prices. If you want to stay, go soon because the rooms and the restaurant are booked solid during the Fall leaf season.
reviews.title: Fantastic view - fully renovated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had spent our honeymoon at Pisgah Inn 28 years ago and this was our first time back. Not much had changed and that is a good thing. Beautiful views, a nice room and a wonderful restaurant welcomed us back. There is no air conditioning in the room, but at 4,500 feet elevation and in early September, it was not needed. Good air flow is provided by a small front window. Many of the travelers were middle aged couples like us. Many drove up from Asheville to eat at the restaurant, which had spectacular views and great food. The Inn is rather isolated, with Brevard and Asheville a healthy drive in either direction. There is a small grocery store on site, but the fare is limited. All things to consider, but not an issue for us. We hope to make this an annual pilgrimage.
reviews.title: Amazing and peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second visit to the Inn and always enjoy my stay. Room was comfortable, great view from the back balcony, excellent restaurant next door with free breakfast. Look forward to going back next time I'm on the Parkway or even nearby Gatlinburg.
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This may be one of the more hidden gems in Western North Carolina. One of two motels on the entire Blue Ridge Parkway, so the drive to the Inn is just wonderful, multiple tunnnels, great vistas at every turn. We took our bicycles up and enjoyed the Parkway also. The Inn itself sits atop Mt Pisgah so its going to be cooler than just about anywhere in the South. The rooms are good, but the views from the deck are great. Perfect place for wine and a sunset. Don't miss the restaurant the food was great and the service too. Multiple times I needed something from the front desk and each time they were more than accomodating. It was just a great trip and I wanted to say thanks.
reviews.title: It really doesn't get much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the Pisgah Inn for a little getaway one weekend. It's about a half hour drive from Asheville down the Blue Ridge Parkway. We arrived late (11 pm) and fortunately, we had no trouble checking in so late.
reviews.title: Great mountain getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first trip up the Blue Ridge Parkway, it was so foggy, we didn't realize this property existed! On our second trip, we stopped in to investigate the price and amenities. With the view from the mountain, we were expecting the place to be completely booked a year in advance and to be way out of our price range. We were shocked that there was an opening for the following evening and that the price (comparable to what we spend at generic hotels across the country) included a hot breakfast at the attached restaurant. We immediately decided to extend our vacation another day just to stay on this property. The second floor room had two queen beds, mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. We, of course, spent the majority of our time on the porch. It was 62 degrees on the evening we stayed (mid-July) and the breeze was fabulous. It felt safe to leave our door open for the cross breeze until we went to bed. Air-conditioning is completely unnecessary! The room was clean and comfortable. Our neighbors on both sides were quiet (which was a big bonus because you can hear every word spoken on the balconies.) We slept well and woke up refreshed and ready for breakfast. We arrived first with the goal of getting a table by the window (which worked) and it was totally worth it. We watched hummingbirds flying around against the backdrop of the mountains while we were eating. Awesome! Breakfast included veggie sausage options - weren't expecting that!! After we ate, we walked along the property and saw 12 hummingbirds and several chipmunks. We are definitely planning on recommending this place to our friends!
reviews.title: What a surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This wonderful place to stay on the Blue Ridge Parkway just 45 mins. out of Asheville and next to Mt. Pisgah has beautiful mountain views from each rooms porch (and rocking chairs and a table as well!). This was our 2nd visit and both times we had an upper floor double room (2 double beds) and since our last visit (which was in 2008) the furnishings have been upgraded. The staff that tends to your room each day was polite and did a great job; the restaurant had a wonderful variety of food to choose from on their menu (and daily specials) and there were many wonderful wait staff people (cordial, funny, endearing). If you're looking for an ahhhhhhhh place to stay, with many sites and hiking trails nearby, can't go wrong here. And, breakfast is included in the room rates (and lots of great choices for breakfast!). We highly recommend this gem in the mountains.
reviews.title: A beautiful day in the neighborhood...

reviews.text: My family had stayed at this Inn 30 years ago, and I can't say the accommodations have changed much, but sitting on rocking chairs on your balcony puts the world at your feet. So beautiful! Certainly we had everything we needed, and it was clean, but don't expect luxury. On the other hand, I highly value friendly hospitality, and Pisgah Inn delivers that. A major surprise was a really outstanding restaurant on site with wonderful menus for dinner and lunch. Go!
reviews.title: The beauty of the Inn is the beauty of the surroundings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When planning our stay at Pisgah Inn we had visions of small, old-fashioned, rather basic accommodations, but worth the stay because of the location and views. To the contrary, the accommodations were updated and nicely furnished and decorated. Our bedroom with twin beds was roomy with lots of closet and storage space. We had a small refrigerator and all the amenities common to a hotel room. As past reviwers noted, the views from our balcony were wonderful and made you want to just sit in the rocking chairs and enjoy the scenery and the clouds right nearby. The air was cool and comfortable, even in August...but expect some low clouds to affect visability occasionally. The complimentary breakfasts included several choices, served by friendly waiters and waitresses, and were very good. We ate dinner here several nights and enjoyed the food, the ambiance and the views from the panoramic windows. We would definitely stay here again when visiting North Carolina.
reviews.title: Great stay that exceeded our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have always loved to camp in the blue ridge parkway.mount Mitchell etc. but stayed at this cute inn and it was so nice and relaxing. Had beautiful views from room and balony with rocking chairs. To be so high up in elevation, we had cable tv and wifi.Also has a restraunt for all meals. Ate lunch there and in the morning had a complimentary full breakfast.delicious. Prices are reasonable.
reviews.title: Spent our 30 year anniversary here
